00001 #ifndef INCLUDE_git_oid_h__
00002 #define INCLUDE_git_oid_h__
00003 
00004 #include "common.h"
00005 #include <string.h>
00006 
00007 /**
00008  * @file git/oid.h
00009  * @brief Git object id routines
00010  * @defgroup git_oid Git object id routines
00011  * @ingroup Git
00012  * @{
00013  */
00014 GIT_BEGIN_DECL
00015 
00016 /** Size (in bytes) of a raw/binary oid */
00017 #define GIT_OID_RAWSZ 20
00018 
00019 /** Size (in bytes) of a hex formatted oid */
00020 #define GIT_OID_HEXSZ (GIT_OID_RAWSZ * 2)
00021 
00022 /** Unique identity of any object (commit, tree, blob, tag). */
00023 typedef struct {
00024         /** raw binary formatted id */
00025         unsigned char id[GIT_OID_RAWSZ];
00026 } git_oid;
00027 
00028 /**
00029  * Parse a hex formatted object id into a git_oid.
00030  * @param out oid structure the result is written into.
00031  * @param str input hex string; must be pointing at the start of
00032  *        the hex sequence and have at least the number of bytes
00033  *        needed for an oid encoded in hex (40 bytes).
00034  * @return GIT_SUCCESS if valid; GIT_ENOTOID on failure.
00035  */
00036 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_oid_mkstr(git_oid *out, const char *str);
00037 
00038 /**
00039  * Copy an already raw oid into a git_oid structure.
00040  * @param out oid structure the result is written into.
00041  * @param raw the raw input bytes to be copied.
00042  */
00043 GIT_INLINE(void) git_oid_mkraw(git_oid *out, const unsigned char *raw)
00044 {
00045         memcpy(out->id, raw, sizeof(out->id));
00046 }
00047 
00048 /**
00049  * Format a git_oid into a hex string.
00050  * @param str output hex string; must be pointing at the start of
00051  *        the hex sequence and have at least the number of bytes
00052  *        needed for an oid encoded in hex (40 bytes).  Only the
00053  *        oid digits are written; a '\\0' terminator must be added
00054  *        by the caller if it is required.
00055  * @param oid oid structure to format.
00056  */
00057 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_oid_fmt(char *str, const git_oid *oid);
00058 
00059 /**
00060  * Format a git_oid into a loose-object path string.
00061  * <p>
00062  * The resulting string is "aa/...", where "aa" is the first two
00063  * hex digitis of the oid and "..." is the remaining 38 digits.
00064  *
00065  * @param str output hex string; must be pointing at the start of
00066  *        the hex sequence and have at least the number of bytes
00067  *        needed for an oid encoded in hex (41 bytes).  Only the
00068  *        oid digits are written; a '\\0' terminator must be added
00069  *        by the caller if it is required.
00070  * @param oid oid structure to format.
00071  */
00072 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_oid_pathfmt(char *str, const git_oid *oid);
00073 
00074 /**
00075  * Format a gid_oid into a newly allocated c-string.
00076  * @param oid the oid structure to format
00077  * @return the c-string; NULL if memory is exhausted.  Caller must
00078  *         deallocate the string with free().
00079  */
00080 GIT_EXTERN(char *) git_oid_allocfmt(const git_oid *oid);
00081 
00082 /**
00083  * Format a git_oid into a buffer as a hex format c-string.
00084  * <p>
00085  * If the buffer is smaller than GIT_OID_HEXSZ+1, then the resulting
00086  * oid c-string will be truncated to n-1 characters. If there are
00087  * any input parameter errors (out == NULL, n == 0, oid == NULL),
00088  * then a pointer to an empty string is returned, so that the return
00089  * value can always be printed.
00090  *
00091  * @param out the buffer into which the oid string is output.
00092  * @param n the size of the out buffer.
00093  * @param oid the oid structure to format.
00094  * @return the out buffer pointer, assuming no input parameter
00095  *         errors, otherwise a pointer to an empty string.
00096  */
00097 GIT_EXTERN(char *) git_oid_to_string(char *out, size_t n, const git_oid *oid);
00098 
00099 /**
00100  * Copy an oid from one structure to another.
00101  * @param out oid structure the result is written into.
00102  * @param src oid structure to copy from.
00103  */
00104 GIT_INLINE(void) git_oid_cpy(git_oid *out, const git_oid *src)
00105 {
00106         memcpy(out->id, src->id, sizeof(out->id));
00107 }
00108 
00109 /**
00110  * Compare two oid structures.
00111  * @param a first oid structure.
00112  * @param b second oid structure.
00113  * @return <0, 0, >0 if a < b, a == b, a > b.
00114  */
00115 GIT_INLINE(int) git_oid_cmp(const git_oid *a, const git_oid *b)
00116 {
00117         return memcmp(a->id, b->id, sizeof(a->id));
00118 }
00119 
00120 /** @} */
00121 GIT_END_DECL
00122 #endif
